nodes.text: The idea of a pre-existing creator is refuted by scientists

Suppose that a skeptic argues that evidence for biological creation by natural selection is obviously lacking and that in the circumstances we ought to give serious consideration to the possibility that the development of life required some input from a pre-existing purposeful creator.
it suggests the possibility that this creator may have communicated in some way with humans.
It is advanced the claim of the existence of a creator
it invokes an entity unknown to science.
To scientific naturalists this suggestion is  creationist  and therefore unacceptable in principle
In that case there could be real prophets-persons with a genuine knowledge of God who are neither frauds nor dreamers
Such persons could conceivably be dangerous rivals for the scientists as cultural authorities.
